Result#

template<typename T = None, typename E = error::SystemError>
class Result : private hyperion::result::ResultData<None, error::SystemError>#

A Result represents the outcome of an operation that can fail recoverably.

Every Result is either Ok, indicating success and containing a desired value or Err, indicating failure and containing an Error type T can be any type or pointer E can be any type, although it is preferred to be an error::Error or error::AnyError, and would ideally be at least an error::ErrorType (a type deriving from error::ErrorBase)

Example: 

#include <Hyperion/Result.h>

using namespace hyperion;

inline auto checked_add(u32 left, u32 right) noexcept -> Result<u32> {
    return left <= std::numeric_limits<u32>::max() - right ? Ok(left + right)
                                                           : Err(SystemError(EDOM));
}

checked_add(25_u32, 120939_u32).match([](u32 value) {
        println("sum is: {}", value);
    },
    [](auto&& err) {
        eprintln("failed to add values: {}", err.message());
    });

Note

While any combination of T and E can be pointers, Result will NOT take ownership of any pointer it contains, and as such it is the responsibility of the user to delete a pointer contained in a Result. To have a Result take ownership of a pointer, use a smart-pointer instead such as hyperion::UniquePtr or std::shared_ptr instead of a raw pointer.

Template Parameters

  • T – - the type indicating the outcome of a successful operation in the case of success

  • E – - the type indicating failure in the case of an error

Public Types

using ok_type = typename ResultData::ok_type#

The type of the Ok variant.

using ok_pointer = typename ResultData::ok_pointer#

Pointer to the type of the Ok variant.

using ok_pointer_to_const = typename ResultData::ok_pointer_to_const#

Pointer-to-const to the type of the Ok variant.

using ok_reference = typename ResultData::ok_reference#

Reference to the type of the Ok variant.

using ok_const_reference = typename ResultData::ok_const_reference#

Const reference to the type of the Ok variant.

using ok_rvalue_reference = typename ResultData::ok_extracted#

Rvalue reference (or equivalent) of the type of the Ok variant.

Rvalue reference of ok_type or equivalent. E.g., for a Result storing a pointer, this would be the same as ok_type, but for a bare type, this would be ok_type&&.

using err_type = typename ResultData::err_type#

The type of the Err variant.

using err_pointer = typename ResultData::err_pointer#

Pointer to the type of the Err variant.

using err_pointer_to_const = typename ResultData::err_pointer_to_const#

Pointer-to-const to the type of the Err variant.

using err_reference = typename ResultData::err_reference#

Reference to the type of the Err variant.

using err_const_reference = typename ResultData::err_const_reference#

Const reference to the type of the Err variant.

using err_rvalue_reference = typename ResultData::err_extracted#

Rvalue reference (or equivalent) of the type of the Err variant.

Rvalue reference of err_type or equivalent. E.g., for a Result storing a pointer, this would be the same as err_type, but for a bare type, this would be err_type&&.

Default Constructor.

Constructs a Result from the given T

Constructs a Result by constructing the T in place in the Result

Parameters

args – - The arguments to pass to T’s constructor

Constructs a Result from the given E

Constructs a Result from the given E

Constructs a Result by constructing the E in place in the Result

inline Result(const hyperion::Err<E> &error) noexcept#

Constructs a Result from an Err

Parameters

error – - The error indicating failure

inline Result(hyperion::Err<E> &&error) noexcept#

Constructs a Result from an Err

error – - The error indicating failure

inline constexpr Result(const hyperion::Ok<T> &ok) noexcept#

Constructs a Result from an Ok

Parameters

ok – - The value indicating success

inline constexpr Result(hyperion::Ok<T> &&ok) noexcept#

Constructs a Result from an Ok

Parameters

ok – - The value indicating success

inline constexpr Result(const Result &result) noexcept(concepts::NoexceptCopyConstructible<ResultData>)#

Copy Constructor.

inline constexpr Result(Result &&result) noexcept(concepts::NoexceptMoveConstructible<ResultData>)#

Move Constructor Moving a Result consumes it, leaving a disengaged (valueless) Result in its place.

constexpr ~Result() noexcept(concepts::NoexceptDestructible<ResultData>) = default#

Destructor.

inline constexpr auto is_ok() const noexcept -> bool#

Returns whether this Result is the Ok variant.

Returns

true if this is Ok, otherwise false

inline constexpr auto is_err() const noexcept -> bool#

Returns whether this Result is the Err variant.

Returns

true if this is Err, otherwise false

inline constexpr auto as_ref() noexcept -> ok_reference#

Similar to unwrap, but doesn’t consume this Result.

Returns a reference to the Ok value if this is Ok, otherwise invokes a panic

Returns

A reference to the Ok value

inline constexpr auto as_cref() const noexcept -> ok_const_reference#

Similar to unwrap, but doesn’t consume this Result.

Returns a const reference to the Ok value if this is Ok, otherwise invokes a panic

Returns

A const reference to the Ok value

inline constexpr auto unwrap() noexcept -> ok_type#

Returns the contained T, consuming this Result.

If this is the Ok variant, moves the Ok value out of this and returns it. Otherwise, invokes a panic.

Returns

The contained T

inline constexpr auto unwrap_or(T &default_value) noexcept -> ok_type#

Returns the contained T if this is the Ok variant, consuming this Result.

If this is not the Ok variant, then returns default_value.

Parameters

default_value – - The value to return if this is Err

Returns

The contained T if this is Ok, or default_value

inline constexpr auto unwrap_or(T &&default_value) noexcept -> ok_type#

Returns the contained T if this is the Ok variant, consuming this Result.

If this is not the Ok variant, then returns default_value.

Parameters

default_value – - The value to return if this is Err

Returns

The contained T if this is Ok, or default_value

template<typename F>
inline auto unwrap_or_else(F &&default_generator) noexcept -> T#

Returns the contained T if this is the Ok variant, consuming this Result.

If this is not Ok, then returns the result of invoking default_generator.

Template Parameters

F – - The type of the default_generator invocable

Parameters

default_generator – - The function to generate the value to return if this is Err

Returns

The contained T if this is Ok, or the result of invoking default_generator

template<typename U>
inline auto expect(U &&panic_message) noexcept -> ok_type#

Returns the contained T if this is the Ok variant, consuming this Result.

If this is not the Ok variant, invokes a panic with the given panic_message.

Parameters

panic_message – - The panic message to print if this is not the Ok variant

Returns

The contained T if this is Ok

inline constexpr auto unwrap_err() noexcept -> err_type#

Returns the contained E if this is the Err variant, consuming this Result.

If this is not Err, invokes a panic

Returns

The contained E

inline constexpr auto ok() noexcept -> Option<T>#

Converts this Result into an Option<T>, consuming this Result and discarding the error, if any.

If this is the Ok variant, moves the contained value out of this and returns it as a Some variant Option. Otherwise, returns None.

Returns

Option<T>

inline constexpr auto err() noexcept -> Option<E>#

Converts this Result into an Option<E>, consuming this Result and discarding the success value, if any.

If this is the Ok variant, moves the contained value out of this and returns it as a Some variant Option. Otherwise, returns None.

Returns

Option<E>

template<typename F, typename U = decltype(std::declval<F>()(std::declval<ok_const_reference>()))>
inline auto map(F &&map_func) const noexcept -> Result<U, E>#

Maps this Result to another one with a potentially different Ok type.

If this is the Ok variant, invokes map_func with a const reference to the contained value and returns the result in a new Result. Otherwise, copies the error into a new Result.

Template Parameters

  • F – - The type of the invocable that maps T

  • U – - The type that the invocable F maps T to. This will be deduced. Don’t explicitly provide this

Parameters

map_func – - The invocable to perform the mapping

Returns

the result of map_func wrapped in another Result if this is Ok, otherwise a copy of the error in another Result

template<typename F, typename U>
inline auto map_or(F &&map_func, U &&default_value) const noexcept -> U#

Maps this Result to a U.

If this is the Ok variant, invokes map_func with a const reference to the contained value and returns the result. Otherwise, returns default_value.

Template Parameters

  • F – - The type of the invocable that maps T to U

  • U – - The type to map to

Parameters

  • map_func – - The invocable to perform the mapping

  • default_value – - The default value to return if this is the Err variant

Returns

The result of the mapping if this is Ok, otherwise default_value

template<typename F, concepts::Invocable G, typename U = decltype(std::declval<F>()(std::declval<ok_const_reference>())), typename V = decltype(std::declval<G>()())>
inline auto map_or_else(F &&map_func, G &&default_generator) const noexcept -> U#

Maps this Result to a U.

If this is the Ok variant, invokes map_func with a const reference to the contained value and returns the result. Otherwise, returns the result of invoking default_generator

Note

map_func and default_generator must return the same type

Template Parameters

  • F – - The type of the invocable that maps T

  • G – - The type of the invocable that generates the default value

  • U – - The type that the invocable F maps T to. This will be deduced. Don’t explicitly provide this.

  • V – - The type that the invocable G generates. This will be deduced. Don’t explicitly provide this.

Parameters

  • map_func – - The invocable to perform the mapping

  • default_generator – - The invocable to generate the default value

Returns

The result of the mapping if this is Ok, otherwise the result of invoking default_generator

template<typename F, typename U = decltype(std::declval<F>()(std::declval<err_const_reference>()))>
inline auto map_err(F &&map_func) const noexcept -> Result<T, U>#

Maps this Result to a another one, with a potentially different Error type.

If this is the Ok variant, copies the contained value into a new Result. Otherwise, returns the result of invoking map_func with a const reference to the contained error.

Template Parameters

  • F – - The type of the invocable that maps E

  • U – - The type that the invocable F maps E to. This will be deduced. Don’t explicitly provide this.

Parameters

map_func – - The function to perform the mapping

Returns

the contained value copied into a new Result if this is Ok. Otherwise, the result of the mapping

template<typename OkFunc, typename ErrFunc, typename R1 = decltype(std::declval<OkFunc>()(std::declval<ok_rvalue_reference>())), typename R2 = decltype(std::declval<ErrFunc>()(std::declval<err_rvalue_reference>()))>
inline auto match(OkFunc &&ok_func, ErrFunc &&err_func) noexcept -> R1#

Matches this Result to a consuming function, depending on whether it is the Ok or Err variant.

If this is the Ok variant, the contained T is moved out of this Result and ok_func is called with it as its parameter. Otherwise, this is the Err variant, and the contained E is moved out of this Result and err_func is called with it as its parameter.

Note

The returned type of ok_func and err_func must be the same

Template Parameters

  • OkFunc – - The type of the function to consume the contained value with if this is Ok

  • ErrFunc – - The type of the function to consume the error value with if this is Err

  • R1 – - The type returned by ok_func. This is deduced. Don’t explicitly provide this

  • R2 – - The type returned by err_func. This is deduced. Don’t explicitly provide this

Parameters

  • ok_func – - The function to consume the contained value with if this is Ok

  • err_func – - The function to consume the error value with if this is Err

Returns

The return value of ok_func if this is Ok, otherwise the return value of err_func

template<typename F, typename R = decltype(std::declval<F>()(std::declval<ok_rvalue_reference>()))>
inline auto and_then(F &&func) noexcept -> Result<R, E>#

Continues control flow into func if this is the Ok variant, otherwise returns the Err value contained in this. In either case, consumes this Result.

Template Parameters

  • F – - The type of invocable to call if this is Ok

  • R – - The type of the Ok variant of the Result returned by func. This is deduced. Don’t explicitly provide this.

Parameters

func – - The invocable to call if this is Ok

Returns

the result of invoking func with the contained value, otherwise moves the error value into a new Result

template<typename F, typename V = decltype(std::declval<F>()(std::declval<ok_rvalue_reference>())), typename U = typename V::ok_rvalue_reference, typename R = std::conditional_t<std::is_rvalue_reference_v<U>, std::remove_reference_t<U>, U>>
inline auto and_then(F &&func) noexcept -> Result<R, E>#

Continues control flow into func if this is the Ok variant, otherwise returns the Err value contained in this. In either case, consumes this Result.

Template Parameters

  • F – - The type of invocable to call if this is Ok

  • V – - The Result type returned by func. This is deduced. Don’t explicitly provide this.

  • U – - The rvalue reference type of the Ok variant of the Result returned by func. This is deduced. Don’t explicitly provide this.

  • R – - The type of the Ok variant of the Result returned by func. This is deduced. Don’t explicitly provide this.

Parameters

func – - The invocable to call if this is Ok

Returns

the result of invoking func with the contained value, otherwise moves the error value into a new Result

template<typename F>
inline auto or_else(Result<T, F> &&result) const noexcept -> Result<T, F>#

Forwards the value contained in this into a new Result, consuming this Result.

If this is the Ok variant, moves the contained value out of this into a new Result and returns it. Otherwise, returns result.

Template Parameters

F – - The type of the Err variant of result

Parameters

result – - The next Result to potentially use

Returns

result if this is Err, the contained value moved into a new Result otherwise

template<typename F, typename U = typename or_else_result<F>::err_rvalue_reference, typename R = std::conditional_t<std::is_rvalue_reference_v<U>, std::remove_reference_t<U>, U>>
inline auto or_else(F &&func) noexcept -> Result<T, R>#

Forwards the value contained in this into a new Result, consuming this Result.

If this is the Ok variant, moves the contained value out of this into a new Result and returns it. Otherwise, moves the contained error out of this and returns the result of invoking func with it.

Template Parameters

  • F – - The type of invocable to call if this is Err

  • U – - The type of the Err variant of the Result returned by F. This is deduced. Don’t explicitly provide this.

Parameters

func – - The invocable to call if this is Err

Returns

the result of invoking func with the contained error if this is Err, otherwise the contained value in a new Result

inline constexpr operator bool() const noexcept#

Boolean conversion operator. Returns true if this is the Ok variant.

Returns

true if this is Ok, false otherwise

inline constexpr auto operator=(const Result &result) noexcept(concepts::NoexceptCopyAssignable<ResultData>) -> Result&#

Copy assignment operator.

inline constexpr auto operator=(Result &&result) noexcept(concepts::NoexceptMoveAssignable<ResultData>) -> Result&#

Move assignment operator. Moving a Result consumes it, leaving a disengaged (valueless) Result in its place.

template<typename T = option::None>
struct Ok#

Ok wraps and represents and the value of a successful operation and is used to create a Result in the Ok variant

Template Parameters

T – - The type of the value

template<typename E = error::SystemError>
struct Err#

Err wraps and represents and error value and is used to create a Result in the Err variant

Template Parameters

E – - The error type
